steps.text: Define risk as a potentially harmful event.
Identify different types of risks affecting a company's success.
Identify, analyze, assess, and process organization's risks.
Make risk management a part of daily operations.
Decide based on risk management results.
Company management is responsible for safety.
Issue clear instructions.
Supervise compliance.
Evaluate machine's fire risk based on operating environment.
Identify potential fire hazards in the machine.
Consider impact on the company's other risks.
Evaluate the level of risk the company is taking.
Assess employee actions in an accident.
Fire risk arises when a machine is put into service.
Monitor machines for signs of temperature rise, vibration, and wear.
Follow manufacturer's instructions for scheduled maintenance.
Participate in manufacturer recall campaigns.
Use authentic replacement parts.
Inspect and clean engine compartment and surroundings daily in dusty or fire-hazard conditions.
Clean at least once a week in other environments.
Use compressed air to remove dirt after cleaning.
Inspect for leaks after cleaning.
Keep engine compartment clean.
Avoid exposure of flammable liquids to hot surfaces above 240°C.
Shut down the engine before inspecting for fuel leaks.
Check joints of hoses and pipes for fuel leaks.
Inspect engine compartment for oil leaks.
Protect hydraulic hoses from high temperatures.
Inspect electrical systems visually at least once a year.
Service electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines.
Measure voltage drops using a multimeter.
Use a thermal imaging camera to detect anomalies in alternators, cables, and earthing points.
Compare readings with an intact machine.
Locate the main power switch outside the engine compartment for machines over 500 kg.
Mark the switch visibly.
Check that power is cut off when the switch is used.
Locate and operate the emergency kill switch before starting the machine.
Repair any malfunction that required the use of the emergency kill switch before resuming operation.
Do not use it for a normal shutdown.
Repair any deviations immediately.
Ensure cable terminals are intact and firmly attached.
Protect cable terminal covers to prevent overheating.
Ensure the battery compartment has sufficient ventilation.
Check cables not protected by a fuse, including battery, alternator, and starter motor, several times a year.
Inspect lead-throughs for rubber collars.
Replace cables exhibiting abrasion or heat damage.
Protect cables with a housing pipe.
Keep cables clean of oil and dirt.
Protect and firmly attach cable harnesses.
Ensure tight cable connections with terminal covers.
Check electric panel during maintenance.
Ensure fuse boxes are intact and have lids.
Check that fuses are the correct size.
Investigate cause of any blown fuse.
Fasten cables with brackets no more than 150 mm apart.
Use fasteners and cable ties that can withstand temperatures of 120°C.
Do not attach cables to flammable material pipes or hoses.
Firmly attach alternator with correct belt tension and install terminal covers.
Clean alternator filter to prevent overheating.
Inspect alternator for anomalies using a thermal camera.
Check fasteners, belts, and bearings.
Replace noisy bearings.
Check exhaust pipe for leaks and ensure thermal shields are in place.
Ensure no flammable liquid hoses are too close to the exhaust pipe.
Ensure regeneration occurs in a safe outdoor environment.
Wait for machine indication of regeneration need.
Allow regeneration process to commence.
Check if machine is in fire-hazard environment.
Delay process if hazard is present.
Never leave machine unattended during regeneration.
Inspect hoses and electrical systems in swivelling joint weekly.
Remove rocks or twigs immediately.
Make sure all operating manuals are accessible in language understood by operator.
Check cleanliness and condition of auxiliary heater, its compartment, and wiring before winter.
Clean and check for fuel leaks in the heater compartment.
Inspect the heater's exhaust pipe.
Test the heater under supervision.
Machines over 3000 kg require a minimum of two 34A233B fire extinguishers.
Frost-resistant liquid-based extinguishers are recommended for such machines.
Machines used for crushing timber or energy waste need four 34A233B fire extinguishers.
Extinguishers must be available, clearly marked, and serviced annually.
Operators must be trained.
Autonomous machines need a fixed fire extinguishing system.
Protect hot components, flammable liquid hoses/tanks, and electrical components with the system.
Require six litres of agent per protected cubic metre.
Detection system covers entire engine compartment.
Protect hydraulic hoses in the engine compartment with thermal protection tubes.
Install a fixed, fully automatic fire extinguishing system in machines with dust or fire hazards.
Provide at least three litres of extinguishing agent for each cubic meter of engine or heater compartment.
Cover the entire engine compartment with the detection system.
Connect the detection system to non-fused cables.
Obtain a certificate for installation.
Ensure compliance with requirements by providing a test report.
Confirm the system's operation at start-up.
Repair any malfunctions immediately by an authorized shop.
Service the system at least once a year.
Clean engine compartments daily.
Identify and mark fire extinguishing openings.
Use approved extinguisher equipment suppliers.
Inspect signs and markings.
Check machine electrical systems.
Inspect engine mechanics.
Examine first-aid extinguishing equipment.
Inspect auxiliary heater.
Check mains power systems.
Assess general condition and cleanliness.
Remain calm.
Shut down the engine as quickly as possible.
If indoors, move the machine outdoors first.
If near flammable material, move the machine before shutting down.
Cut electricity from the main power switch.
Call for help (emergency number 112).
Use the 112 smartphone app if possible.
Perform first-aid fire extinguishing.
Have the fire department confirm the fire is out.
Report the incident to the safety officer, site manager, coworkers, and insurance company.
Report all accidents and dangerous situations to a supervisor immediately.
Stop and leave the machine in place if possible.
Wear protective clothing and a helmet.
Use a hands-free device for phone calls.
Wear a safety belt.
Use stepladders and handrails.
Maintain three points of contact when climbing.
Keep doors closed during operation.
Ensure tools are secure.
Mark emergency exits.
Repair malfunctions promptly.
Arrange practical training on accident and fire procedures.
Inspect cables and fasteners for security, heat resistance, insulation, and lead-throughs.
Examine fuses and batteries for condition of non-fused cables and terminal covers.
Clean engine and heater compartments.
Check first-aid extinguishing equipment for availability, markings, and operator training.

constraints.text: Ensure high-quality, ongoing service and maintenance to prevent fires.
Flammable liquids like hydraulic oil, diesel fuel, and motor oil pose a fire risk when hot.
Inspect electrical systems annually and document inspections.
Service electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines.
Use a thermal imaging camera for detecting anomalies in alternators, cables, and earthing points.
Main power switch for machines over 500 kg must be located outside the engine compartment and visibly marked.
Ensure the emergency kill switch is functional before operating the machine.
No flammable liquid hoses should be too close to the exhaust pipe.
Perform regeneration in a safe outdoor environment.
Avoid flammable materials during regeneration.
Machine is in a fire-hazard environment.
Machines over 3,000 kg require a minimum of two fire extinguishers.
Frost-resistant liquid-based extinguishers are recommended for machines over 3,000 kg.
Machines used for crushing timber or energy waste need four fire extinguishers.
Extinguishers must be available, clearly marked, and serviced annually.
Operators must be trained before using autonomous machines.
Fire extinguishing system requirements for autonomous machines.
Machines in environments with dust or fire hazards must have the specified fire extinguishing system.
Provide sufficient extinguishing agent as per the given requirement.
The detection system must cover the entire engine compartment and be connected to non-fused cables.
Installation requires a certificate.
Compliance requires a test report.
Any malfunction must be repaired immediately.
